intro: Eschatogramme panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian eschatogramme, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and purple. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
